nodes.bodyText: This really old PatternFly version is required by @kogito-tooling/embedded-editor. Its usage is confined to the iframe of the embedded editor.

We can probably move kogito-apps/ui-packages/packages/trusty to @kogito-tooling/embedded-editor@0.6.1
This uses @patternfly/patternfly@4.16.7 see here.
I'll try it locally first.
Can you walk me through this? When is/should be the prepare script being used?
The prepare script is one of the predefined npm life-cycle scripts. It gets executed automatically after the install script. Which is the right moment to extract the embedded editor.

Ah, so this will run on each build of the ui-packages maven module, right?
That might lead to excessive time needed for build of unrelated projects (e.g. management-console), when they're being run separately. I am not aware of the details here, regarding the size of downloaded artifact or how the changes affect the build speed - please provide your view.
The current setup is the following:

ui-packages - maven project to build ALL the UI packages using yarn
quarkus-apps (e.g. kogito-apps/management-console) that take the bundle from ui-packages/packages/management-console/dist and creating a executable jar.
the quarkus app has maven dependency on ui-packages to build the react apps first when building just a single module instead of whole repo - that's when the build time takes the hit.

If we decide this change is affecting our build time in local dev workflow (not sure if anyone actually works with the project that way) we can deal with this in a separate enhancement.

Yes, it will run on each build of ui-packages.
I don't see any performance issue though. The prepare script is way faster then the install one for example.
It takes ~2s on my local env.

that might be due to the fact it is cached (maven command using -nsu).
Just checked the PR check - in clean environment the kie-bc-editors-unpacked maven build takes  17.100 s , that seems reasonable. As I mentioned, it can be tweaked later.
Thanks for the explanation.
Hm, is there any other reason for this pom than downloading the editor war file? Should the packaging be still jar? I'd say pom could be enough ...

nodes.bodyText: This copies the approach (100%) in kogito-tooling. See here. If there are recommendations to be made that can be applied across all of this type of use-case I think a JIRA reporting the issue and proposing a solution would be great.

nodes.bodyText: this version needs to be explicitly updated, no automated update happens when the project moves between versions. Just checking if that's desirable.

nodes.bodyText:
Correct.. and it's probably not a bad thing; as trusty can tie itself to a stable editor release if needed.
kogito-tooling takes an identical approach (updating the version as needed). See here.
Admittedly we could probably move to 7.42.0-SNAPSHOT in this PR.

nodes.bodyText: Please comment with any reservations to the current lint settings in KOGITO-3189.
the status field is not from axios here? cause there it's defined as number ...
Almost. Here the status field is a different one used to save the request status inside setInputData. The instruction is inside the then callback, which is executed when the request succeeds.
Ah, ok, resolving the comment then.
